title: SpotPrice - FX
description: Schema for spot prices for FX instruments (e.g., currency pairs).

id.description: Unique identifier for the document, typically composed of dataType, assetClass, assetId, date, documentType, and version.

schemaVersion.description: Version of the schema this document complies with (e.g., '0.0').

version.description: Version number of this specific market data record (used to track multiple saves or corrections).

assetId.description: Identifier for the underlying asset or currency pair (e.g., 'EURUSD').

assetClass.description: Specifies the asset class; fixed as 'fx' for foreign exchange instruments.

dataType.description: Type of market data contained in the document, fixed as 'price.spot' for spot prices.

tags.description: Array of tags for additional metadata classification or filtering (e.g., ['spot', 'eod']).

documentType.description: Classification of the data based on timing or source: 'official' (end-of-day), 'intraday' (midday), or 'live' (streaming quote).

region.description: Region or market to which the market data applies (e.g., 'EMEA', 'APAC', 'Americas').

createTimestamp.description: Timestamp representing when the market data was generated or updated, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2025-04-27T15:30:00Z').

asOfDate.description: The market date the price is valid for, in ISO 8601 format ('yyyy-MM-dd').

asOfTime.description: The specific time (HH:mm or HH:mm:ss) associated with the asOfDate, representing the moment the data was recorded. Example: '15:30' or '15:30:45'. This should be interpreted as UTC time.

price.description: The spot price of the FX instrument (e.g., 1.0985 for EUR/USD).

side.description: The side of the price quote, e.g., mid, bid, or ask
